intro: Matthiola pseudoxyceras var. basiceras, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wallflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in racemes, and bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
